Description.Name: AC/10 Ammo
Description.Details: Large caliber rounds capable of dealing heavy damage, and designed to be used in an AC/10.

Description.Name: AC/2 Ammo
Description.Details: Small caliber ammunition designed for long range fire in an AC/2.

Description.Name: AC/20 Ammo
Description.Details: Massive rounds, designed for devastating impact, to be used in an AC/20.

Description.Name: AC/5 Ammo
Description.Details: Moderate caliber rounds, suitable for long range fire in an AC/5.

Description.Name: Flamer Ammo
Description.Details: Flamer Ammo. SHOULD NOT BE PURCHASABLE OR AVAILABLE!!! Flamers should have internal ammo only.

Description.Name: LRM Ammo
Description.Details: Long range missiles, capable of dealing moderate damage at long range. Each missile lacks punch, but in a group they can deal significant damage.

Description.Name: MG Ammo
Description.Details: Large bore belted ammunition for 'Mech-mounted machine guns.

Description.Name: SRM Ammo
Description.Details: Short range missiles, capable of dealing heavy damage at close range via shaped charge warheads.

Description.Name: AC/10 Ammo
Description.Details: Ammo Bins contain the rounds needed for projectile-based weaponry, with at least one bin required per weapon type. Ammo Bins will explode and destroy their installed location when they receive a Critical Hit. AC/10 Ammo Bins each contain 8 rounds and may feed multiple weapons.

Description.Name: AC/2 Ammo
Description.Details: Ammo Bins contain the rounds needed for projectile-based weaponry, with at least one bin required per weapon type. Ammo Bins will explode and destroy their installed location when they receive a Critical Hit. AC/2 Ammo Bins each contain 25 rounds and may feed multiple weapons.

Description.Name: AC/20 Ammo
Description.Details: Ammo Bins contain the rounds needed for projectile-based weaponry, with at least one bin required per weapon type. Ammo Bins will explode and destroy their installed location when they receive a Critical Hit. AC/20 Ammo Bins each contain 5 rounds and may feed multiple weapons.

Description.Name: AC/5 Ammo
Description.Details: Ammo Bins contain the rounds needed for projectile-based weaponry, with at least one bin required per weapon type. Ammo Bins will explode and destroy their installed location when they receive a Critical Hit. AC/5 Ammo Bins each contain 15 rounds and may feed multiple weapons.

Description.Name: Flamer
Description.Details: Ammo Bins contain the rounds needed for projectile-based weaponry, with at least one bin required per weapon type. Ammo Bins will explode and destroy their installed location when they receive a Critical Hit. Flamer Ammo Bins each contain 6 rounds and may feed multiple weapons.

Description.Name: Gauss Ammo
Description.Details: Ammo Bins contain the rounds needed for projectile-based weaponry, with at least one bin required per weapon type. Ammo Bins will explode and destroy their installed location when they receive a Critical Hit. Gauss Ammo Bins each contain 8 rounds and may feed multiple weapons.

Description.Name: LRM Ammo
Description.Details: Ammo Bins contain the rounds needed for projectile-based weaponry, with at least one bin required per weapon type. Ammo Bins will explode and destroy their installed location when they receive a Critical Hit. LRM Ammo Bins each contain 120 rounds and may feed multiple weapons.

Description.Name: MG Ammo
Description.Details: Ammo Bins contain the rounds needed for projectile-based weaponry, with at least one bin required per weapon type. Ammo Bins will explode and destroy their installed location when they receive a Critical Hit. Machine Gun Ammo Bins each contain 200 rounds and may feed multiple weapons.

Description.Name: SRM Ammo
Description.Details: Ammo Bins contain the rounds needed for projectile-based weaponry, with at least one bin required per weapon type. Ammo Bins will explode and destroy their installed location when they receive a Critical Hit. SRM Ammo Bins each contain 100 rounds and may feed multiple weapons.

Description.Name: Flamer Ammo
Description.Details: Flamer Ammo. SHOULD NOT BE PURCHASABLE OR AVAILABLE!!! Flamers should have internal ammo only.

Description.Name: Atlas II
Description.Details: Known as the 'Atlas II,' the D-HT model carries more Energy weaponry and usually a lighter, more flexible Autocannon. It still has unbelievable protection and the same crushing Melee ability as other Atlas models.

chassisdef_atlas_AS7-D-HT.YangsThoughts: Known as the 'Atlas II,' the D-HT model carries more Energy weaponry and usually a lighter, more flexible Autocannon. It still has unbelievable protection and the same crushing Melee ability as other Atlas models.

Description.Name: Atlas
Description.Details: The Atlas D is the king of the battlefield, capable of bringing a dizzying array of weapons to bear on targets at any range. It is also noteworthy for normally mounting the maximum amount of armor possible. Few opponents can survive even brief contact with this monster.

chassisdef_atlas_AS7-D.YangsThoughts: The Atlas D is the king of the battlefield, capable of bringing a dizzying array of weapons to bear on targets at any range. It is also noteworthy for normally mounting the maximum amount of armor possible. Few opponents can survive even brief contact with this monster.

Description.Name: Awesome
Description.Details: A 'Mech that truly lives up to its name! The Awesome 8Q mounts a frightening trio of PPCs that can destroy, knock down, or debilitate any target in no time. It's ungainly, but it can shrug off huge amounts of incoming fire.

chassisdef_awesome_AWS-8Q.YangsThoughts: A 'Mech that truly lives up to its name! The Awesome 8Q mounts a frightening trio of PPCs that can destroy, knock down, or debilitate any target in no time. It's ungainly, but it can shrug off huge amounts of incoming fire.

Description.Name: Awesome
Description.Details: The Awesome 8T is a superb fire support 'Mech, though its heavy armor is a bit wasted in that role. It can still put up a good fight at medium ranges, and it can crush smaller units outright with Melee attacks.

chassisdef_awesome_AWS-8T.YangsThoughts: The Awesome 8T is a superb fire support 'Mech, though its heavy armor is a bit wasted in that role. It can still put up a good fight at medium ranges, and it can crush smaller units outright with Melee attacks.

Description.Name: Banshee
Description.Details: The Banshee 3E was originally designed for close combat, with better speed than most other assault 'Mechs. While it has heavy armor and powerful Melee attack capability, its firepower is severely lacking and it can still be flanked by lighter units.

chassisdef_banshee_BNC-3E.YangsThoughts: The Banshee 3E was originally designed for close combat, with better speed than most other assault 'Mechs. While it has heavy armor and powerful Melee attack capability, its firepower is severely lacking and it can still be flanked by lighter units.

Description.Name: Banshee
Description.Details: The Banshee 3M mounts respectable weaponry with better-than-average speed and armor. This comes at the cost of very poor heat management. It's good at hunting lighter units, especially if it can close to Melee range.

chassisdef_banshee_BNC-3M.YangsThoughts: The Banshee 3M mounts respectable weaponry with better-than-average speed and armor. This comes at the cost of very poor heat management. It's good at hunting lighter units, especially if it can close to Melee range.

Description.Name: Banshee
Description.Details: The Banshee 3S sacrifices its trademark speed for a large expansion in firepower. The 3S fills the role of a well armored sniper, sporting two PPCs and an AC10 while still being capable of inflicting heavy melee damage.

chassisdef_banshee_BNC-3S.YangsThoughts: The Banshee 3S is slower than the stock design, but it can take a punch while pummeling an enemy to the ground. If you're unsatisfied with the stock Banshee's lack of firepower, this is the variant you've been waiting for, Commander.

Description.Name: BattleMaster
Description.Details: Versatile and powerful, the BattleMaster 1G is one of the best known BattleMechs in existence. Normally mounting a varied array of Energy weapons, the BattleMaster can engage enemies at any range and packs a powerful punch.

chassisdef_battlemaster_BLR-1G.YangsThoughts: Versatile and powerful, the BattleMaster 1G is one of the best known BattleMechs in existence. Normally mounting a varied array of Energy weapons, the BattleMaster can engage enemies at any range and packs a powerful punch.

Description.Name: Blackjack
Description.Details: Blackjack 1s are solid, well-rounded 'Mechs for their tonnage. They typically mount Jump Jets, which give them an extra edge by repositioning quickly to keep a direct line of fire for their Autocannons.

chassisdef_blackjack_BJ-1.YangsThoughts: Blackjack 1s are solid, well-rounded 'Mechs for their tonnage. They typically mount Jump Jets, which give them an extra edge by repositioning quickly to keep a direct line of fire for their Autocannons.

Description.Name: Blackjack
Description.Details: With the BJ-1DB, the Federated Suns have revised the Blackjack into a dedicated fire support 'Mech. The 1DB's two large lasers can burn through heavily-armored targets at long range without sacrificing a medium 'Mech's maneuverability.

chassisdef_blackjack_BJ-1DB.YangsThoughts: Two large lasers at 45 tons! That's the pitch for the BJ-1DB. Out of the box, this 'Mech lays down fantastic firepower at long range, and can keep it going for long engagements.

Description.Name: Black Knight
Description.Details: The Black Knight 6-KNT is a dedicated Energy weapon platform. It can shell out hellish damage with its beams and shrug off a lot of damage… just gotta make sure to keep its heat in check.

chassisdef_blackknight_BL-6-KNT.YangsThoughts: The Black Knight 6-KNT is a dedicated Energy weapon platform. It can shell out hellish damage with its beams and shrug off a lot of damage… just gotta make sure to keep its heat in check.

Description.Name: Black Knight
Description.Details: The Black Knight 6B was the harder-hitting, cooler-running Star League ancestor to the standard BL-6-KNT we have today. It did everything the 6 does, but better—mostly thanks to its Double Heat Sinks, which are basically nonexistent these days.

chassisdef_blackknight_BL-6b-KNT.YangsThoughts: The Black Knight 6B was the harder-hitting, cooler-running Star League ancestor to the standard BL-6-KNT we have today. It did everything the 6 does, but better—mostly thanks to its Double Heat Sinks, which are basically nonexistent these days.

Description.Name: Cataphract
Description.Details: We call the Cataphract a "FrankenMech" because it's got a little bit of everything stitched together on it. The 1X model works well at medium-long to closer range, with good armor and weaponry.

chassisdef_cataphract_CTF-1X.YangsThoughts: We call the Cataphract a "FrankenMech" because it's got a little bit of everything stitched together on it. The 1X model works well at medium-long to closer range, with good armor and weaponry.

Description.Name: Catapult
Description.Details: Ah, the Catapult C1. Just like its namesake, it's good at lobbing large numbers of missiles over terrain without fear of return fire. Surprisingly, it's also not too shabby at closer ranges in a pinch.

chassisdef_catapult_CPLT-C1.YangsThoughts: Ah, the Catapult C1. Just like its namesake, it's good at lobbing large numbers of missiles over terrain without fear of return fire. Surprisingly, it's also not too shabby at closer ranges in a pinch.

Description.Name: Catapult
Description.Details: All Catapult variants are fundamentally artillery platforms. The CPLT-C4 is optimized for massed LRM fire. That optimization costs it flexibility compared to the original C1. Lacking the C1's medium lasers, the C4 is usually kept at long range in a fire support role.

chassisdef_catapult_CPLT-C4.YangsThoughts: Do you like LRMs? Compared to the CPLT-C1, the C4 is focused on doing one thing and doing it well. And that thing is putting a cloud of missiles in the air with two LRM-20 launchers. There's a lot you can do with this 'Mech, as long as what you want to do is shoot a lot of missiles. When it runs out of missiles, it has jump jets and reinforced leg armor…

Description.Name: Catapult
Description.Details: The Catapult K2 is an outside-the-box redesign that trades the indirect-fire capability for heavier direct-fire PPCs. It doesn't usually mount Jump Jets, though, so it can be a bit more restricted in its use.

chassisdef_catapult_CPLT-K2.YangsThoughts: The Catapult K2 is an outside-the-box redesign that trades the indirect-fire capability for heavier direct-fire PPCs. It doesn't usually mount Jump Jets, though, so it can be a bit more restricted in its use.

Description.Name: Centurion
Description.Details: A sturdy and reliable 'Mech, the Centurion is good at both taking and giving a beating. CN9-A models are able to engage at any range, but their damage curve increases as they approach a target.

chassisdef_centurion_CN9-A.YangsThoughts: A sturdy and reliable 'Mech, the Centurion is good at both taking and giving a beating. CN9-A models are able to engage at any range, but their damage curve increases as they approach a target.

Description.Name: Centurion
Description.Details: The AL variant of the Centurion tends to trade the larger burst damage of an Autocannon for more Energy weaponry and heavier armor. ALs can take an incredible amount of damage for their size but still pack a good punch.

chassisdef_centurion_CN9-AL.YangsThoughts: The AL variant of the Centurion tends to trade the larger burst damage of an Autocannon for more Energy weaponry and heavier armor. ALs can take an incredible amount of damage for their size but still pack a good punch.

Description.Name: Target Dummy
Description.Details: The Centurion A is designed to complement the Trebuchet as a spotter and direct-line 'Mech. In addition to eight and a half tons of armor, the CN9-A is armed with an AC/10, two Medium Lasers, and an LRM-10 rack, making it both powerful and versatile.

Description.Name: Cicada
Description.Details: In all honesty, Cicadas as a rule are very fragile. The 2A model was designed to be as fast as any light 'Mech, but that massive engine leaves little room for much else. Still, if you use it cautiously, it can be a successful scout and diversion.

chassisdef_cicada_CDA-2A.YangsThoughts: In all honesty, Cicadas as a rule are very fragile. The 2A model was designed to be as fast as any light 'Mech, but that massive engine leaves little room for much else. Still, if you use it cautiously, it can be a successful scout and diversion.

Description.Name: Cicada
Description.Details: The Cicada 3C is slightly slower than the 2A but has more room for weaponry and armor. It still generally underperforms in most areas except speed, but it can put up more of a fight, with better survival rates.

chassisdef_cicada_CDA-3C.YangsThoughts: The Cicada 3C is slightly slower than the 2A but has more room for weaponry and armor. It still generally underperforms in most areas except speed, but it can put up more of a fight, with better survival rates.

Description.Name: Commando
Description.Details: The Large Laser mounted by most 1B models is nothing to sniff at, but it lacks the close-up impact of the SRMs it replaces. Best to keep these units at range for flanking and spotting.

chassisdef_commando_COM-1B.YangsThoughts: The Large Laser mounted by most 1B models is nothing to sniff at, but it lacks the close-up impact of the SRMs it replaces. Best to keep these units at range for flanking and spotting.

Description.Name: Commando
Description.Details: With all those SRMs, the COM-2D is like a small, highly mobile shotgun that can take down 'Mechs twice its size or bigger. You've gotta be careful with it, though, because it's not meant to take much of a beating.

chassisdef_commando_COM-2D.YangsThoughts: With all those SRMs, the COM-2D is like a small, highly mobile shotgun that can take down 'Mechs twice its size or bigger. You've gotta be careful with it, though, because it's not meant to take much of a beating.

Description.Name: Dragon
Description.Details: The Dragon 1N is a beefy machine that can take a serious beating but tends to be a bit light on weaponry. It moves fast for a heavy 'Mech, though, which makes it well suited to closing for Melee attacks against slower targets.

chassisdef_dragon_DRG-1N.YangsThoughts: The Dragon 1N is a beefy machine that can take a serious beating but tends to be a bit light on weaponry. It moves fast for a heavy 'Mech, though, which makes it well suited to closing for Melee attacks against slower targets.

Description.Name: Enforcer
Description.Details: Enforcer 4R models combine the hefty power of an Autocannon and massive Laser with the mobility of Jump Jets—a deadly combination. Able to engage at medium-long all the way to point-blank range, these 'Mechs are flexible and surprising in combat.

chassisdef_enforcer_ENF-4R.YangsThoughts: Enforcer 4R models combine the hefty power of an Autocannon and massive Laser with the mobility of Jump Jets—a deadly combination. Able to engage at medium-long all the way to point-blank range, these 'Mechs are flexible and surprising in combat.

Description.Name: Firestarter
Description.Details: The Firestarter is a dangerous 'Mech for its tonnage—carefully timed attacks with its Flamers can shut down any 'Mech and leave it open to punishment from your other forces. The FS9-H also makes a decent light 'Mech hunter-killer.

chassisdef_firestarter_FS9-H.YangsThoughts: The Firestarter is a dangerous 'Mech for its tonnage—carefully timed attacks with its Flamers can shut down any 'Mech and leave it open to punishment from your other forces. The FS9-H also makes a decent light 'Mech hunter-killer.

Description.Name: Grasshopper
Description.Details: Don't be fooled by its whimsical name—the Grasshopper is a killer that specializes in hunting down light and medium 'Mechs. Its superb jump ability and good armor allow it to get behind foes easily to bring its all-Energy weapons to bear.

chassisdef_grasshopper_GHR-5H.YangsThoughts: Don't be fooled by its whimsical name—the Grasshopper is a killer that specializes in hunting down light and medium 'Mechs. Its superb jump ability and good armor allow it to get behind foes easily to bring its all-Energy weapons to bear.

Description.Name: Griffin
Description.Details: Griffin 1Ns use their Jump Jets to stay at range and pelt their opponents from relative safety. 1Ns can run hot if they spend all their time bounding around the battlefield taking potshots, though.

chassisdef_griffin_GRF-1N.YangsThoughts: Griffin 1Ns use their Jump Jets to stay at range and pelt their opponents from relative safety. 1Ns can run hot if they spend all their time bounding around the battlefield taking potshots, though.

Description.Name: Griffin
Description.Details: Griffin 1Ss mount closer-range weaponry than their 1N cousins, allowing them to jump in for closer attacks and then move away to disengage or flank. They're generally better at dealing with heat buildup, too.

chassisdef_griffin_GRF-1S.YangsThoughts: Griffin 1Ss mount closer-range weaponry than their 1N cousins, allowing them to jump in for closer attacks and then move away to disengage or flank. They're generally better at dealing with heat buildup, too.

Description.Name: Griffin
Description.Details: The Griffin 2N is an old Star League model that was among the most versatile 'Mechs in its heyday. Its weapons generated a lot of heat, but the old Double Heat Sinks were put in to handle it. It's almost impossible to find those anymore, though.

chassisdef_griffin_GRF-4N.YangsThoughts: The Griffin 2N is an old Star League model that was among the most versatile 'Mechs in its heyday. Its weapons generated a lot of heat, but the old Double Heat Sinks were put in to handle it. It's almost impossible to find those anymore, though.

Description.Name: Highlander
Description.Details: The Highlander 732B is an ancient model from the Star League days! Its Gauss Rifle was a terrifying weapon that gave it a huge punch at almost any range—but you can't find those anymore. And of course, it still has the jump capability it's always been known for.

chassisdef_highlander_HGN-732b.YangsThoughts: The Highlander 732B is an ancient model from the Star League days! Its Gauss Rifle was a terrifying weapon that gave it a huge punch at almost any range—but you can't find those anymore. And of course, it still has the jump capability it's always been known for.

Description.Name: Highlander
Description.Details: The Highlander 733 is one of the few jump-capable assault 'Mechs. A mixture of medium- and long-range weaponry ensures that while the Highlander excels at no particular role, it is decent at all of them.

chassisdef_highlander_HGN-733.YangsThoughts: The Highlander 733 is one of the few jump-capable assault 'Mechs. A mixture of medium- and long-range weaponry ensures that while the Highlander excels at no particular role, it is decent at all of them.

Description.Name: Highlander
Description.Details: The Highlander 733P is a variant of the 733 model that removes its Autocannon and replaces it with a PPC. It also handles heat buildup better.

chassisdef_highlander_HGN-733P.YangsThoughts: The Highlander 733P is a variant of the 733 model that removes its Autocannon and replaces it with a PPC. It also handles heat buildup better.

Description.Name: Hunchback
Description.Details: The Hunchback 4G is a tried and tested juggernaut on the field. One of the lightest 'Mechs to mount such a massive Autocannon, it is capable of destroying some lighter units in a single volley. It tends to mount heavy armor to boot.

chassisdef_hunchback_HBK-4G.YangsThoughts: The Hunchback 4G is a tried and tested juggernaut on the field. One of the lightest 'Mechs to mount such a massive Autocannon, it is capable of destroying some lighter units in a single volley. It tends to mount heavy armor to boot.

Description.Name: Hunchback
Description.Details: The 4P version of the Hunchback trades the singular impact of a massive Autocannon for a frightening array of lighter Energy weaponry that is actually capable of dealing more damage overall. This all comes at the cost of greatly increased heat buildup, of course.

chassisdef_hunchback_HBK-4P.YangsThoughts: The 4P version of the Hunchback trades the singular impact of a massive Autocannon for a frightening array of lighter Energy weaponry that is actually capable of dealing more damage overall. This all comes at the cost of greatly increased heat buildup, of course.

Description.Name: JagerMech
Description.Details: The JagerMech A model attempts to provide an indirect-fire support platform that can dish out damage without ever being seen. It has lower overall focused damage capability, but it usually mounts decent armor.

chassisdef_jagermech_JM6-A.YangsThoughts: The JagerMech A model attempts to provide an indirect-fire support platform that can dish out damage without ever being seen. It has lower overall focused damage capability, but it usually mounts decent armor.

Description.Name: JagerMech
Description.Details: The JagerMech S model is highly specialized at long-range Autocannon fire support. It doesn't have much in the way of protection or closer-range weapons, though, so keep it distant and out of harm's way.

chassisdef_jagermech_JM6-S.YangsThoughts: The JagerMech S model is highly specialized at long-range Autocannon fire support. It doesn't have much in the way of protection or closer-range weapons, though, so keep it distant and out of harm's way.

Description.Name: Jenner
Description.Details: Jenner Ds run hot, and they run fast but can quickly bound into combat to deliver a knockout punch, even against heavier units. Their capability with speed and weaponry tends to come at the expense of lower armor capacity, though.

chassisdef_jenner_JR7-D.YangsThoughts: Jenner Ds run hot, and they run fast but can quickly bound into combat to deliver a knockout punch, even against heavier units. Their capability with speed and weaponry tends to come at the expense of lower armor capacity, though.

Description.Name: King Crab
Description.Details: One of the most heavily armed and armored 'Mechs ever constructed, the King Crab 0000 is capable of massive burst damage. A pair of heavy, close-range Autocannons form its primary weaponry, backed up by ranged weaponry to fire as it closes distance.

chassisdef_kingcrab_KGC-0000.YangsThoughts: One of the most heavily armed and armored 'Mechs ever constructed, the King Crab 0000 is capable of massive burst damage. A pair of heavy, close-range Autocannons form its primary weaponry, backed up by ranged weaponry to fire as it closes distance.

Description.Name: Kintaro
Description.Details: The Kintaro 18 is… a beast of a machine. It's fast for its size, mounts heavy armor, and can literally shred most other 'Mechs with its almost ridiculous amount of close-range weaponry. But, it runs hotter than Hell's saunas.

chassisdef_kintaro_KTO-18.YangsThoughts: The Kintaro 18 is… a beast of a machine. It's fast for its size, mounts heavy armor, and can literally shred most other 'Mechs with its almost ridiculous amount of close-range weaponry. But, it runs hotter than Hell's saunas.

Description.Name: Locust
Description.Details: The Locust's 1M model is interesting in that it can churn out a decent volley of LRMs for such a small 'Mech. It's a great harasser, especially if you can use its speed to lob missiles into the weaker rear armor of targets. But it normally has almost no armor itself.

chassisdef_locust_LCT-1M.YangsThoughts: The Locust's 1M model is interesting in that it can churn out a decent volley of LRMs for such a small 'Mech. It's a great harasser, especially if you can use its speed to lob missiles into the weaker rear armor of targets. But it normally has almost no armor itself.

Description.Name: Locust
Description.Details: Locust 1S models tend to sacrifice the little armor they normally mount to fire respectable SRM salvos. Definitely useful for hit-and-runs, especially if those shots provide the extra punch to knock down a target.

chassisdef_locust_LCT-1S.YangsThoughts: Locust 1S models tend to sacrifice the little armor they normally mount to fire respectable SRM salvos. Definitely useful for hit-and-runs, especially if those shots provide the extra punch to knock down a target.

Description.Name: Locust
Description.Details: The basic Locust 1V has one big advantage: speed. It's not meant to put up much of a fight, but you'd be hard-pressed to find a 'Mech that goes further and is harder to hit.

chassisdef_locust_LCT-1V.YangsThoughts: The basic Locust 1V has one big advantage: speed. It's not meant to put up much of a fight, but you'd be hard-pressed to find a 'Mech that goes further and is harder to hit.

Description.Name: Orion
Description.Details: The Orion K was the first true heavy 'Mech. As a multirole brawler, the Orion can engage enemies at a variety of ranges, and with plenty of armor, it can survive combined fire for quite some time. Slow, yes—but powerful.

chassisdef_orion_ON1-K.YangsThoughts: The Orion K was the first true heavy 'Mech. As a multirole brawler, the Orion can engage enemies at a variety of ranges, and with plenty of armor, it can survive combined fire for quite some time. Slow, yes—but powerful.

Description.Name: Orion
Description.Details: The Orion V trades some of the armor the K model is known for to mount additional weaponry. This increases its overall damage output, but many pilots consider the loss of armor to be risky.

chassisdef_orion_ON1-V.YangsThoughts: The Orion V trades some of the armor the K model is known for to mount additional weaponry. This increases its overall damage output, but many pilots consider the loss of armor to be risky.

Description.Name: Panther
Description.Details: Panther 9Rs are solid all-around 'Mechs, if a bit on the slow side. They make up for it with Jump Jets, considerable armor, and a hefty punch from their trademark PPC. They've even been used in physical slugging matches to good effect.

chassisdef_panther_PNT-9R.YangsThoughts: Panther 9Rs are solid all-around 'Mechs, if a bit on the slow side. They make up for it with Jump Jets, considerable armor, and a hefty punch from their trademark PPC. They've even been used in physical slugging matches to good effect.

Description.Name: Target Dummy
Description.Details: A Light support 'Mech, the Panther 9R is capable of providing powerful covering fire. The 9R usually covers fast-moving Light 'Mechs as they engage the enemy, but it is equally at home using its Jump Jets to flank.

Description.Name: Quickdraw
Description.Details: Quickdraw 4Gs are among the fastest and most maneuverable of heavy 'Mechs, with decent weaponry. They suffer from problematic heat buildup when using all their features at once, so some caution is needed.

chassisdef_quickdraw_QKD-4G.YangsThoughts: Quickdraw 4Gs are among the fastest and most maneuverable of heavy 'Mechs, with decent weaponry. They suffer from problematic heat buildup when using all their features at once, so some caution is needed.

Description.Name: Quickdraw
Description.Details: The Quickdraw 5A was designed to give the 'Mech more endurance than the stock 4G. By removing the LRM-10, two additional Medium Lasers and four additional Heat Sinks could be mounted. Unfortunately, the 5A still runs too hot for most pilots.

chassisdef_quickdraw_QKD-5A.YangsThoughts: The Quickdraw 5A was designed to give the 'Mech more endurance than the stock 4G. By removing the LRM-10, two additional Medium Lasers and four additional Heat Sinks could be mounted. Unfortunately, the 5A still runs too hot for most pilots.

Description.Name: Shadow Hawk
Description.Details: The Shadow Hawk 2D is an interesting model. Its default payload sacrifices a lot of armor to mount a bit more firepower, though some argue the tradeoff isn't worth it. Its Alpha Strikes are better, though, so… I guess you can be the judge.

chassisdef_shadowhawk_SHD-2D.YangsThoughts: The Shadow Hawk 2D is an interesting model. Its default payload sacrifices a lot of armor to mount a bit more firepower, though some argue the tradeoff isn't worth it. Its Alpha Strikes are better, though, so… I guess you can be the judge.

Description.Name: Shadow Hawk
Description.Details: The Shadow Hawk 2H is the perfect example of a 'jack-of-all-trades.' It supports weaponry for all ranges, has respectable speed and jump capability, and mounts decent armor. This comes at the cost of excelling at nothing in particular.

chassisdef_shadowhawk_SHD-2H.YangsThoughts: The Shadow Hawk 2H is the perfect example of a 'jack-of-all-trades.' It supports weaponry for all ranges, has respectable speed and jump capability, and mounts decent armor. This comes at the cost of excelling at nothing in particular.

Description.Name: Spider
Description.Details: The Spider 5V is hands down the most maneuverable 'Mech you can field… but it's made of paper. It's an excellent scout, though, and can even jump into the rear arc of most enemies for surprise back shots.

chassisdef_spider_SDR-5V.YangsThoughts: The Spider 5V is hands down the most maneuverable 'Mech you can field… but it's made of paper. It's an excellent scout, though, and can even jump into the rear arc of most enemies for surprise back shots.

Description.Name: Stalker
Description.Details: The Stalker 3F mounts a ridiculous amount of weaponry—even for an assault 'Mech. It is also notable for its incredibly poor heat management, which is the cost it pays for such amazing damage output. Powerful, but to be used wisely.

chassisdef_stalker_STK-3F.YangsThoughts: The Stalker 3F mounts a ridiculous amount of weaponry—even for an assault 'Mech. It is also notable for its incredibly poor heat management, which is the cost it pays for such amazing damage output. Powerful, but to be used wisely.

Description.Name: Thunderbolt
Description.Details: The Thunderbolt 5S is well-armed and heavily armored for its size. It's often deployed as a frontline 'Mech where the fighting is heavy, and it needs to give as good as it gets.

chassisdef_thunderbolt_TDR-5S.YangsThoughts: The Thunderbolt 5S is well-armed and heavily armored for its size. It's often deployed as a frontline 'Mech where the fighting is heavy, and it needs to give as good as it gets.

Description.Name: Thunderbolt
Description.Details: Thunderbolt SE models lose a little of their firepower in exchange for mounting Jump Jets. The greater mobility is intended to allow for more precision attacking maneuvers, though it all depends on the battlefield terrain.

chassisdef_thunderbolt_TDR-5SE.YangsThoughts: Thunderbolt SE models lose a little of their firepower in exchange for mounting Jump Jets. The greater mobility is intended to allow for more precision attacking maneuvers, though it all depends on the battlefield terrain.

Description.Name: Thunderbolt
Description.Details: Known for its superb heat management, the Thunderbolt 5SS hits hard at long range with its PPC and then closes to disable or destroy its target with close-range weaponry.

chassisdef_thunderbolt_TDR-5SS.YangsThoughts: Known for its superb heat management, the Thunderbolt 5SS hits hard at long range with its PPC and then closes to disable or destroy its target with close-range weaponry.

Description.Name: Trebuchet
Description.Details: One of the lightest dedicated fire support 'Mechs to be found, the Trebuchet 5N can mount enough missiles to give even heavy units pause. However, 'Trenchbuckets' are known for running hot and don't have much in the way of protection.

chassisdef_trebuchet_TBT-5N.YangsThoughts: One of the lightest dedicated fire support 'Mechs to be found, the Trebuchet 5N can mount enough missiles to give even heavy units pause. However, 'Trenchbuckets' are known for running hot and don't have much in the way of protection.

Description.Name: Target Dummy
Description.Details: The UrbanMech R60 was designed for exactly what the name implies: combat in dense urban areas. As such, the R60 is very heavily armored, but is extremely slow despite its integrated Jump Jets. Armed with a Small Laser and an AC/10, the R60 is a deadly opponent against similarly-sized 'Mechs - if it can get close enough to fight them.

Description.Name: UrbanMech
Description.Details: Don't let the stubby 'Urbie' fool you—it may look like a walking trash can, but it can mount heavy armor and a grown-up-sized Autocannon. R60s aren't known for their speed, but they are very useful if you can draw the enemy into their firing range.

chassisdef_urbanmech_UM-R60.YangsThoughts: Don't let the stubby 'Urbie' fool you—it may look like a walking trash can, but it can mount heavy armor and a grown-up-sized Autocannon. R60s aren't known for their speed, but they are very useful if you can draw the enemy into their firing range.

Description.Name: UrbanMech
Description.Details: The UM-R60L is a modification of the standard R60 UrbanMech that replaces the AC/10 and 2 tons of armor with an AC/20 to double its firepower. With even less combat endurance than the R60, the R60L is favored in ambush or hit-and-run tactics.

chassisdef_urbanmech_UM-R60L.YangsThoughts: An R60L UrbanMech is a lot like the normal R60, but with an even bigger autocannon and even less armor. It's everything you love and hate about the UrbanMech taken to an extreme.

Description.Name: SuburbanMech
Description.Details: The UM-R90 'SuburbanMech' adapts the traditional UrbanMech R60 into an energy weapon platform for higher performance. Because its weapons aren't limited by ammunition concerns, the R90 is better-suited to longer engagements.

chassisdef_urbanmech_UM-R90.YangsThoughts: This is an UrbanMech variant I've never even heard of before. It's got the same armor as a standard R60, but this R90 is armed entirely with energy weapons, including a PPC for long-range power. I'm not sure why nobody thought of this sooner.

Description.Name: Victor
Description.Details: Few assault 'Mechs mount Jump Jets, but the Victor 9B is one of 'em. With a large ballistic gun and supporting close-range weaponry, the 9B is a deadly opponent with superior mobility for its size. Unfortunately, this comes at the cost of armor.

chassisdef_victor_VTR-9B.YangsThoughts: Few assault 'Mechs mount Jump Jets, but the Victor 9B is one of 'em. With a large ballistic gun and supporting close-range weaponry, the 9B is a deadly opponent with superior mobility for its size. Unfortunately, this comes at the cost of armor.

Description.Name: Victor
Description.Details: The Victor 9S trades some of its already subpar armor to mount more weaponry. It's terrifying for enemy forces to see this 'Mech rocketing over a hill to unleash its considerable firepower, but it also needs to really worry about any return fire.

chassisdef_victor_VTR-9S.YangsThoughts: The Victor 9S trades some of its already subpar armor to mount more weaponry. It's terrifying for enemy forces to see this 'Mech rocketing over a hill to unleash its considerable firepower, but it also needs to really worry about any return fire.

Description.Name: Vindicator
Description.Details: The VND-1AA carries only half the armor of the more common VND-1R, but uses the saved weight to upgrade the engine. The finished design is a very mobile medium 'Mech suitable for skirmishing and 'shoot and scoot' sniping.

chassisdef_vindicator_VND-1AA.YangsThoughts: The 'Avenging Angel' only has 4.5 tons of armor, and tries to make up for that with greater speed and jump capability. I'm not sure its test pilots were all that happy with the results, but the VND-1AA is still a fast way to move a PPC and a few LRMs around the edge of a fight.

Description.Name: Vindicator
Description.Details: Vindicator 1Rs tend to deal their damage at range while moving in for closer attacks. Typically well armored, they're capable of some surprise attacks due to their jump capability and above-average heat efficiency.

chassisdef_vindicator_VND-1R.YangsThoughts: Vindicator 1Rs tend to deal their damage at range while moving in for closer attacks. Typically well armored, they're capable of some surprise attacks due to their jump capability and above-average heat efficiency.

Description.Name: Wolverine
Description.Details: Wolverine 6K models don't usually include Jump Jets in order to mount more Energy weaponry, Heat Sinks, and armor.

chassisdef_wolverine_WVR-6K.YangsThoughts: Wolverine 6K models don't usually include Jump Jets in order to mount more Energy weaponry, Heat Sinks, and armor.

Description.Name: Wolverine
Description.Details: Wolverine 6Rs are fairly flexible in terms of weaponry ranges, tending somewhat more toward closer engagements. This is supported by their jump capability and pretty decent heat management.

chassisdef_wolverine_WVR-6R.YangsThoughts: Wolverine 6Rs are fairly flexible in terms of weaponry ranges, tending somewhat more toward closer engagements. This is supported by their jump capability and pretty decent heat management.

Description.Name: Zeus
Description.Details: The Zeus 6S moves faster than many other assault 'Mechs and mounts decent long-range weaponry. Its armor is very good, but it can get stuck in a tight spot if forced into closer-range fights.

chassisdef_zeus_ZEU-6S.YangsThoughts: The Zeus 6S moves faster than many other assault 'Mechs and mounts decent long-range weaponry. Its armor is very good, but it can get stuck in a tight spot if forced into closer-range fights.

Description.Name: Bulk Bank Heat Bank
Description.Details: Heat Banks are installed to allow for more thermal energy collection, increasing the threshold at which internal damage occurs from excess heat buildup and thus boosting sustained weapons fire capability.

Description.Name: MAX HEAT INCREASED
Description.Details: Maximum allowed heat increased by [AMT].

Description.Name: Increased Overheat Level
Description.Details: Overheat threshold increased by 15

Description.Name: Double Heat Sink (D)
Description.Details: Double Heat Sinks provide twice the efficiency of standard Heat Sinks, though with increased bulkiness. Like standard Heat Sinks, their effectiveness can be impacted by the surrounding environment, positively or negatively.

Description.Name: Improved Bank Heat Bank
Description.Details: Heat Banks are installed to allow for more thermal energy collection, increasing the threshold at which internal damage occurs from excess heat buildup and thus boosting sustained weapons fire capability.

Description.Name: MAX HEAT INCREASED
Description.Details: Maximum allowed heat increased by [AMT].

Description.Name: Increased Overheat Level
Description.Details: Overheat threshold increased by 10

Description.Name: Standard Bank Heat Bank
Description.Details: Heat Banks are installed to allow for more thermal energy collection, increasing the threshold at which internal damage occurs from excess heat buildup and thus boosting sustained weapons fire capability.

Description.Name: MAX HEAT INCREASED
Description.Details: Maximum allowed heat increased by [AMT].

Description.Name: Increased Overheat Level
Description.Details: Overheat threshold increased by 5

Description.Name: Standard Heat Sink
Description.Details: Heat Sinks actively expel thermal energy generated from firing weaponry or other sources, preventing damage from excessive heat buildup. Their effectiveness can be impacted by the surrounding environment, positively or negatively.

Description.Name: Thermal Exchanger I
Description.Details: Thermal Exchangers reduce the overall heat generated from weapon attacks by a fixed percentage. Unlike Heat Sink components, Thermal Exchangers are not impacted by the surrounding environment.

Description.Name: HEAT GENERATION DECREASED
Description.Details: Heat generation reduced by [AMT].

Description.Name: Thermal Exchanger II
Description.Details: Thermal Exchangers reduce the overall heat generated from weapon attacks by a fixed percentage. Unlike Heat Sink components, Thermal Exchangers are not impacted by the surrounding environment.

Description.Name: HEAT GENERATION DECREASED
Description.Details: Heat generation reduced by [AMT].

Description.Name: Thermal Exchanger III
Description.Details: Thermal Exchangers reduce the overall heat generated from weapon attacks by a fixed percentage. Unlike Heat Sink components, Thermal Exchangers are not impacted by the surrounding environment.

Description.Name: HEAT GENERATION DECREASED
Description.Details: Heat generation reduced by [AMT].

Description.Name: Assault Jump Jet (A)
Description.Details: Jump Jets funnel superheated air to propel 'Mechs over obstacles in a controlled manner. Additionally, they may also be used to perform the dreaded 'Death from Above' attack. Assault Jump Jets are specially designed for use on 'Mechs 90 tons and heavier.

Description.Name: Heavy Jump Jet (H)
Description.Details: Jump Jets funnel superheated air to propel 'Mechs over obstacles in a controlled manner. Additionally, they may also be used to perform the dreaded 'Death from Above' attack. Heavy Jump Jets are specially designed for use on 'Mechs from 60 to 85 tons.

Description.Name: Standard Jump Jet (S)
Description.Details: Jump Jets funnel superheated air to propel 'Mechs over obstacles in a controlled manner. Additionally, they may also be used to perform the dreaded 'Death from Above' attack. Standard Jump Jets are specially designed for use on 'Mechs up to 55 tons.

Description.Name: Atlas II
Description.Details: Known as the 'Atlas II,' the D-HT model carries more Energy weaponry and usually a lighter, more flexible Autocannon. It still has unbelievable protection and the same crushing Melee ability as other Atlas models.

Description.Name: Atlas
Description.Details: The Atlas D is the king of the battlefield, capable of bringing a dizzying array of weapons to bear on targets at any range. It is also noteworthy for normally mounting the maximum amount of armor possible. Few opponents can survive even brief contact with this monster.

Description.Name: Awesome
Description.Details: A 'Mech that truly lives up to its name! The Awesome 8Q mounts a frightening trio of PPCs that can destroy, knock down, or debilitate any target in no time. It's ungainly, but it can shrug off huge amounts of incoming fire.

Description.Name: Awesome
Description.Details: The Awesome 8T is a superb fire support 'Mech, though its heavy armor is a bit wasted in that role. It can still put up a good fight at medium ranges, and it can crush smaller units outright with Melee attacks.

Description.Name: Banshee
Description.Details: The Banshee 3E was originally designed for close combat, with better speed than most other assault 'Mechs. While it has heavy armor and powerful Melee attack capability, its firepower is severely lacking and it can still be flanked by lighter units.

Description.Name: Banshee
Description.Details: The Banshee 3M mounts respectable weaponry with better-than-average speed and armor. This comes at the cost of very poor heat management. It's good at hunting lighter units, especially if it can close to Melee range.

Description.Name: Banshee
Description.Details: The Banshee 3S sacrifices its trademark speed for a large expansion in firepower. The 3S fills the role of a well armored sniper, sporting two PPCs and an AC10 while still being capable of inflicting heavy melee damage.

Description.Name: Battlemaster
Description.Details: Versatile and powerful, the BattleMaster 1G is one of the best known BattleMechs in existence. Normally mounting a varied array of Energy weapons, the BattleMaster can engage enemies at any range and packs a powerful punch.

Description.Name: Blackjack
Description.Details: Blackjack 1s are solid, well-rounded 'Mechs for their tonnage. They typically mount Jump Jets, which give them an extra edge by repositioning quickly to keep a direct line of fire for their Autocannons.

Description.Name: Blackjack
Description.Details: With the BJ-1DB, the Federated Suns have revised the Blackjack into a dedicated fire support 'Mech. The 1DB's two large lasers can burn through heavily-armored targets at long range without sacrificing a medium 'Mech's maneuverability.

Description.Name: Black Knight
Description.Details: The Black Knight 6-KNT is a dedicated Energy weapon platform. It can shell out hellish damage with its beams and shrug off a lot of damage… just gotta make sure to keep its heat in check.

Description.Name: Black Knight
Description.Details: The Black Knight 6B was the harder-hitting, cooler-running Star League ancestor to the standard BL-6-KNT we have today. It did everything the 6 does, but better—mostly thanks to its Double Heat Sinks, which are basically nonexistent these days.

Description.Name: Cataphract
Description.Details: We call the Cataphract a "FrankenMech" because it's got a little bit of everything stitched together on it. The 1X model works well at medium-long to closer range, with good armor and weaponry.

Description.Name: Catapult
Description.Details: Ah, the Catapult C1. Just like its namesake, it's good at lobbing large numbers of missiles over terrain without fear of return fire. Surprisingly, it's also not too shabby at closer ranges in a pinch.

Description.Name: Catapult
Description.Details: All Catapult variants are fundamentally artillery platforms. The CPLT-C4 is optimized for massed LRM fire. That optimization costs it flexibility compared to the original C1. Lacking the C1's medium lasers, the C4 is usually kept at long range in a fire support role.

Description.Name: Catapult
Description.Details: The Catapult K2 is an outside-the-box redesign that trades the indirect-fire capability for heavier direct-fire PPCs. It doesn't usually mount Jump Jets, though, so it can be a bit more restricted in its use.

Description.Name: Centurion
Description.Details: A sturdy and reliable 'Mech, the Centurion is good at both taking and giving a beating. CN9-A models are able to engage at any range, but their damage curve increases as they approach a target.

Description.Name: Centurion
Description.Details: The AL variant of the Centurion tends to trade the larger burst damage of an Autocannon for more Energy weaponry and heavier armor. ALs can take an incredible amount of damage for their size but still pack a good punch.

Description.Name: Centurion
Description.Details: The Centurion A is designed as direct-line 'Mech, being both powerful and versatile. In addition to good armor, the CN9-A normally mounts an AC/10, two Medium Lasers, and an LRM-10 rack. This stripped-down 'Mech sports only a single Medium Laser, though.

Description.Name: Cicada
Description.Details: In all honesty, Cicadas as a rule are very fragile. The 2A model was designed to be as fast as any light 'Mech, but that massive engine leaves little room for much else. Still, if you use it cautiously, it can be a successful scout and diversion.

Description.Name: Cicada
Description.Details: The Cicada 3C is slightly slower than the 2A but has more room for weaponry and armor. It still generally underperforms in most areas except speed, but it can put up more of a fight, with better survival rates.

Description.Name: Commando
Description.Details: The Large Laser mounted by most 1B models is nothing to sniff at, but it lacks the close-up impact of the SRMs it replaces. Best to keep these units at range for flanking and spotting.

Description.Name: Commando
Description.Details: With all those SRMs, the COM-2D is like a small, highly mobile shotgun that can take down 'Mechs twice its size or bigger. You've gotta be careful with it, though, because it's not meant to take much of a beating.

Description.Name: Dragon
Description.Details: The Dragon 1N is a beefy machine that can take a serious beating but tends to be a bit light on weaponry. It moves fast for a heavy 'Mech, though, which makes it well suited to closing for Melee attacks against slower targets.

Description.Name: Enforcer
Description.Details: Enforcer 4R models combine the hefty power of an Autocannon and massive Laser with the mobility of Jump Jets—a deadly combination. Able to engage at medium-long all the way to point-blank range, these 'Mechs are flexible and surprising in combat.

Description.Name: Firestarter
Description.Details: The Firestarter is a dangerous 'Mech for its tonnage—carefully timed attacks with its Flamers can shut down any 'Mech and leave it open to punishment from your other forces. The FS9-H also makes a decent light 'Mech hunter-killer.

Description.Name: Grasshopper
Description.Details: Don't be fooled by its whimsical name—the Grasshopper is a killer that specializes in hunting down light and medium 'Mechs. Its superb jump ability and good armor allow it to get behind foes easily to bring its all-Energy weapons to bear.

Description.Name: Griffin
Description.Details: Griffin 1Ns use their Jump Jets to stay at range and pelt their opponents from relative safety. 1Ns can run hot if they spend all their time bounding around the battlefield taking potshots, though.

Description.Name: Griffin
Description.Details: Griffin 1Ss mount closer-range weaponry than their 1N cousins, allowing them to jump in for closer attacks and then move away to disengage or flank. They're generally better at dealing with heat buildup, too.

Description.Name: Griffin
Description.Details: The Griffin 2N is an old Star League model that was among the most versatile 'Mechs in its heyday. Its weapons generated a lot of heat, but the old Double Heat Sinks were put in to handle it. It's almost impossible to find those anymore, though.

Description.Name: Griffin
Description.Details: The Griffin 2N is an old Star League model that was among the most versatile 'Mechs in its heyday. Its weapons generated a lot of heat, but the old Double Heat Sinks were put in to handle it. It's almost impossible to find those anymore, though.

Description.Name: Highlander
Description.Details: The Highlander 732B is an ancient model from the Star League days! Its Gauss Rifle was a terrifying weapon that gave it a huge punch at almost any rangeâ€”but you can't find those anymore. And of course, it still has the jump capability it's always been known for.

Description.Name: Highlander
Description.Details: The Highlander 733 is one of the few jump-capable assault 'Mechs. A mixture of medium- and long-range weaponry ensures that while the Highlander excels at no particular role, it is decent at all of them.

Description.Name: Highlander
Description.Details: The Highlander 733P is a variant of the 733 model that removes its Autocannon and replaces it with a PPC. It also handles heat buildup better.

Description.Name: Hunchback
Description.Details: The Hunchback 4G is a tried and tested juggernaut on the field. One of the lightest 'Mechs to mount such a massive Autocannon, it is capable of destroying some lighter units in a single volley. It tends to mount heavy armor to boot.

Description.Name: Hunchback
Description.Details: The 4P version of the Hunchback trades the singular impact of a massive Autocannon for a frightening array of lighter Energy weaponry that is actually capable of dealing more damage overall. This all comes at the cost of greatly increased heat buildup, of course.

Description.Name: JagerMech
Description.Details: The JagerMech A model attempts to provide an indirect-fire support platform that can dish out damage without ever being seen. It has lower overall focused damage capability, but it usually mounts decent armor.

Description.Name: JagerMech
Description.Details: The JagerMech S model is highly specialized at long-range Autocannon fire support. It doesn't have much in the way of protection or closer-range weapons, though, so keep it distant and out of harm's way.

Description.Name: Jenner
Description.Details: Jenner Ds run hot, and they run fast but can quickly bound into combat to deliver a knockout punch, even against heavier units. Their capability with speed and weaponry tends to come at the expense of lower armor capacity, though.

Description.Name: King Crab
Description.Details: One of the most heavily armed and armored 'Mechs ever constructed, the King Crab 0000 is capable of massive burst damage. A pair of heavy, close-range Autocannons form its primary weaponry, backed up by ranged weaponry to fire as it closes distance.

Description.Name: Kingcrab
Description.Details: One of the most heavily armed and armored 'Mechs ever constructed, the King Crab 0000 is capable of massive burst damage. A pair of heavy, close-range Autocannons form its primary weaponry, backed up by ranged weaponry to fire as it closes distance.

Description.Name: Kintaro
Description.Details: The Kintaro 18 is… a beast of a machine. It's fast for its size, mounts heavy armor, and can literally shred most other 'Mechs with its almost ridiculous amount of close-range weaponry. But, it runs hotter than Hell's saunas.

Description.Name: Locust
Description.Details: The Locust's 1M model is interesting in that it can churn out a decent volley of LRMs for such a small 'Mech. It's a great harasser, especially if you can use its speed to lob missiles into the weaker rear armor of targets. But it normally has almost no armor itself.

Description.Name: Locust
Description.Details: Locust 1S models tend to sacrifice the little armor they normally mount to fire respectable SRM salvos. Definitely useful for hit-and-runs, especially if those shots provide the extra punch to knock down a target.

Description.Name: Locust
Description.Details: The basic Locust 1V has one big advantage: speed. It's not meant to put up much of a fight, but you'd be hard-pressed to find a 'Mech that goes further and is harder to hit.

Description.Name: Orion
Description.Details: The Orion K was the first true heavy 'Mech. As a multirole brawler, the Orion can engage enemies at a variety of ranges, and with plenty of armor, it can survive combined fire for quite some time. Slow, yes—but powerful.

Description.Name: Orion
Description.Details: The Orion V trades some of the armor the K model is known for to mount additional weaponry. This increases its overall damage output, but many pilots consider the loss of armor to be risky.

Description.Name: Panther
Description.Details: Panther 9R's are solid all-around 'Mechs, if a bit on the slow side. They make up for it with jump jets, considerable armor, and a hefty punch from their trademark PPC. They've even been used in physical slugging matches to good effect.

Description.Name: Quickdraw
Description.Details: Quickdraw 4Gs are among the fastest and most maneuverable of heavy 'Mechs, with decent weaponry. They suffer from problematic heat buildup when using all their features at once, so some caution is needed.

Description.Name: Quickdraw
Description.Details: The Quickdraw 5A was designed to give the 'Mech more endurance than the stock 4G. By removing the LRM-10, two additional Medium Lasers and four additional Heat Sinks could be mounted. Unfortunately, the 5A still runs too hot for most pilots.

Description.Name: Shadow Hawk
Description.Details: The 2D Shadow Hawk is an interesting model. It's default payload sacrifces a lot of armor to mount a bit more firepower, though some argue the tradeoff isn't worth it. Its Alpha Strikes *are* better though so... I guess you can be the judge.

Description.Name: Shadow Hawk
Description.Details: The Shadow Hawk 2D is an interesting model. Its default payload sacrifices a lot of armor to mount a bit more firepower, though some argue the tradeoff isn't worth it. Its Alpha Strikes are better, though, so… I guess you can be the judge.

Description.Name: Shadow Hawk
Description.Details: The Shadow Hawk 2H is the perfect example of a 'jack-of-all-trades.' It supports weaponry for all ranges, has respectable speed and jump capability, and mounts decent armor. This comes at the cost of excelling at nothing in particular.

Description.Name: Spider
Description.Details: The Spider 5V is hands down the most maneuverable 'Mech you can field… but it's made of paper. It's an excellent scout, though, and can even jump into the rear arc of most enemies for surprise back shots.

Description.Name: Stalker
Description.Details: The Stalker 3F mounts a ridiculous amount of weaponry—even for an assault 'Mech. It is also notable for its incredibly poor heat management, which is the cost it pays for such amazing damage output. Powerful, but to be used wisely.

Description.Name: Thunderbolt
Description.Details: The Thunderbolt 5S is well-armed and heavily armored for its size. It's often deployed as a frontline 'Mech where the fighting is heavy, and it needs to give as good as it gets.

Description.Details: Thunderbolt SE models lose a little of their firepower in exchange for mounting Jump Jets. The greater mobility is intended to allow for more precision attacking maneuvers, though it all depends on the battlefield terrain.

Description.Details: Wolverine 6K models don't usually include Jump Jets in order to mount more Energy weaponry, Heat Sinks, and armor.

Description.Name: Wolverine
Description.Details: Wolverine 6Rs are fairly flexible in terms of weaponry ranges, tending somewhat more toward closer engagements. This is supported by their jump capability and pretty decent heat management.

Description.Name: Zeus
Description.Details: The Zeus 6S moves faster than many other assault 'Mechs and mounts decent long-range weaponry. Its armor is very good, but it can get stuck in a tight spot if forced into closer-range fights.

Description.Name: AC/10
Description.Details: One of the most powerful and efficient weapons mounted in combat, AC/10s are known for their heavy damage and ability to stagger opponents. Like all Autocannon weaponry, AC/10s suffer from recoil effects from continuous fire.

Description.Name: AC/10 +
Description.Details: One of the most powerful and efficient weapons mounted in combat, AC/10s are known for their heavy damage and ability to stagger opponents. Like all Autocannon weaponry, AC/10s suffer from recoil effects from continuous fire.

Description.Name: AC/10 +
Description.Details: One of the most powerful and efficient weapons mounted in combat, AC/10s are known for their heavy damage and ability to stagger opponents. Like all Autocannon weaponry, AC/10s suffer from recoil effects from continuous fire.

Description.Details: One of the most powerful and efficient weapons mounted in combat, AC/10s are known for their heavy damage and ability to stagger opponents. Like all Autocannon weaponry, AC/10s suffer from recoil effects from continuous fire.

Description.Details: One of the most powerful and efficient weapons mounted in combat, AC/10s are known for their heavy damage and ability to stagger opponents. Like all Autocannon weaponry, AC/10s suffer from recoil effects from continuous fire.

Description.Details: One of the most powerful and efficient weapons mounted in combat, AC/10s are known for their heavy damage and ability to stagger opponents. Like all Autocannon weaponry, AC/10s suffer from recoil effects from continuous fire.

Description.Name: Flamer
Description.Details: Flamer weapons are unique in that they deal little physical damage but instead expel superheated plasma, applying substantial heat to their target. When done properly, this can hamper enemy return fire or even cause the targeted unit to shut down from overheating.

Description.Name: Gauss Rifle
Description.Details: A Gauss Rifle uses electromagnetic charges to accelerate metallic rounds at extremely high speed, dealing massive damage by kinetic force alone. Unlike Autocannons, Gauss Rifles do not suffer recoil effects from firing and have a baseline bonus to accuracy.

Description.Name: LRM10
Description.Details: The LRM10 rack of Long-Range Missiles occupies a supporting fire role when mounted on most units, with fairly low damage balanced by low heat and ammunition consumption. Like all LRMs, LRM10s are capable of indirect fire over obstacles and terrain with the benefit of a spotter unit.

Description.Name: MG
Description.Details: Machine Guns deal very little damage, have severely limited range, and depend upon volatile ammunition stores. However, they have a greatly increased chance to cause Criticals when they impact a target that has been stripped of its armor.

Description.Name: ER PPC
Description.Details: An improvement upon standard PPCs, Extended-Range PPCs greatly extend their effective range at the cost of incredible heat generation. ER PPCs also generate a mild EM field that degrades the firing capability of their target.

Description.Name: SENSORS IMPAIRED
Description.Details: [AMT] Difficulty to all of this unit's attacks until its next activation.

Description.Name: SRM2
Description.Details: A tiny rack of Short-Range Missiles, SRM2s deal little damage but also cost almost nothing in the way of weight, space, heat, or ammunition consumption. As for all SRMs, SRM2 shots deal above-average stability impact per hit compared to other weapons.
